SiteNameAddress: Land to the north of Main Ridge East, Boston

SiteNameAddress: Land to the north-east of Freiston Road, Boston
Notes: "The South East Lincolnshire Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) (April 2017) identifies that great care would need to be taken in producing a layout and design to ensure a satisfactory relationship to neighbouring dwellings. The site's development would require the use of a relatively narrow existing vehicular access, subject to the Highway Authority's approval. SHLAA ref no: Ski003"

SiteNameAddress: Former Norton Lea (NHS) Site, Cork Tree Crescent, London Road, Boston
Notes: A planning application B/15/0009 for the Demolition of existing buildings and outline consent (up to 60 dwellings) with consideration given to access. (Matters relating to appearance, landscaping, layout and scale are reserved for later approval) has lapsed.  The Site is also a SHLAA site, Sou007 and is shown as a commitment on the SE Lincolnshire Local Plan. (The application had not lapsed on 31 Match 2017, which is the date housing data is calculated at).

SiteNameAddress: Magnadata International, Norfolk Street, Boston

SiteNameAddress: Magnadata International, Horncastle Road, Boston
Notes: Planning permission granted subject to the signing of a s106 agreement (B/16/0011). South East Lincolnshire Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA)(April 2017) ref nos: Wit006 and Wit007 are within the site. There is also land that is in the site and not in the SHLAA.

SiteNameAddress: Land to the north of Fountain Lane, Boston
Notes: The South East Lincolnshire Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (SHLAA) (April 2017) identifies that the site is near to the Boston Conservation Area and listed buildings - adverse impacts should be prevented by careful design. SHLAA ref no: Wit009

SiteNameAddress: Land to the south of Swineshead Road, Boston
Notes: Planning application B/05/0027 was refused and dismissed at appeal. However, the site is identified as a housing allocation capable of providing 85 dwellings in the South East Lincolnshire Local Plan 2011-2036: Publication Version (March 2017), site ref no: Wyb013. The South East Lincolnshire Strategic Housing Land Availability Assessment (April 2017) states that the Highway Authority indicates that access could be achieved via the existing main access off Wortleys Lane (perhaps with some carriageway widening & highway improvements). The existing access off the A52 is potentially acceptable but, as a point of principle, it would be safer if access were taken from Wortleys Lane."
